questions.question: 1. The water content of a soil sample cannot be determined by ____ method.

explanations.a: This method can be used as is demonstrated by this very experiment.
explanations.b: This method is very similar to the oven drying method. Instead of using an oven to dry the soil, the sample is mixed with a methylated spirit and heated with constant stirring. Clearly, this method can be used for water content determination.
explanations.c: This method can be used for water content determination. To know more about this method, click here.
explanations.d: The pipette method is the standard sedimentation method used in laboratory for wet mechanical or sedimentation analysis and cannot be used for water content determination.

questions.question: 2. In the oven drying method, the soil sample is kept for about ____ hours in the oven.

explanations.a: Some soil types may take longer and hence 1 hour is not sufficient in general.
explanations.b: Some soil types may take longer and hence 2 hours is not sufficient in general.
explanations.c: For complete drying, sandy soil takes about 4 hours and fat clays take about 14 to 16 hours. To assure complete drying of the sample for any type of soil, it is kept for about 24 hours.
explanations.d: 48 hours is an excessive amount of time and the soil can be dried in much lesser time for any soil type.

questions.question: 3. The values of water content for natural granular soils vary from less than 0.1% for air dry sands to more than 40% for saturated sands.

explanations.a: Water content depends on the relative density of soil.
